data.title: NBA 2K12: The Official Association/Online Association Thread
meta_keywords: NBA 2K12: The Official Association/Online Association Thread
data.meta_description: Which team looks better? PG- Ricky Rubio, Jose Calderon SG- Demar DeRozan, Tony Allen, Mike Dunleavy SF- Paul George, Carlos Delfino, Lineas Kleiza PF-
data.text:
Rookie

OVR: 0

Join Date: Feb 2012

Re: NBA 2K12: The Official Association/Online Association Thread

Which team looks better?

PG- Ricky Rubio, Jose Calderon

SG- Demar DeRozan, Tony Allen, Mike Dunleavy

SF- Paul George, Carlos Delfino, Lineas Kleiza

PF- Andrea Bargnani, Amir Johnson

C- Marcin Gortat, Jonas Valanciunas, Drew Cook

The above is my current assoication team in NBA 2k12 (Raptors, first year, no fantasy draft, no force trades)

I was thinking whether I should pull a trade a nowitski trade to make my team look like this...

PG- Ricky Rubio, Dhantay Jones

SG- Demar DeRozan, Tony Allen, Mike Dunleavy

SF- Paul George, Carlos Delfino, Lineas Kleiza

PF- Dirk Nowitski, Amir Johnson

C- Andrea Bargnani, Jonas Valanciunas, Drew Cook

I will lose calderon as a good back up point guard and will lose the defense and rebounding of gortat, but I get the clutch shooting and star power of dirk, dirk and Bargs together would be monster on offense, just worried bout the rebounding and post defense.

Rookie

OVR: 0

Join Date: Mar 2011

Re: NBA 2K12: The Official Association/Online Association Thread

Decided to do a fantasy draft with the 76ers. I thought my team was not too bad, as i had a nice starting line up of kyrie irving, evan turner, metta world peace, serge ibaka, and deandre jordan, along with a solid sixth man of marshon brooks.

Needless to say, we were awful. I usually like to sim the first season, and in doing so, we had a 20 game losing streak which led to the benching and trading of metta world peace(basically a trade for the Celtics first round draft pick)

By the end of the season we finished with a record of something like 22-60. Since i drafted a bunch of young players only, my team got much better from the start, and it helped a lot that we won the lottery, and held the 15th pick in the draft. With the first pick, i got SF Anthony Davis, who ended up being a 78(My team led the league in blocking the first year, so Anthony Davis being a beast at blocking too fits in nicely, but may be overkill lol) With the 15th pick, i drafted another SF in Quincy Miller. The logic behind the pick was basically covering me just in case Ibaka leaves. If he does leave, i can move Davis to PF and Miller to starting SF. Im really excited to see what the future holds for my young 76ers team

Rookie

OVR: 3

Join Date: Feb 2011

Blog Entries: 1

Re: NBA 2K12: The Official Association/Online Association Thread

Well after the trade deadline I surveyed the NBA and looked at all 30 teams wondering who I could make the most noise with on 2K. And I looked at the history of the teams and decided to go with the Golden State Warriors - a franchise who finally turned things around with their roster and now look to get back to the playoffs.

Alotta storylines can be played out. Can steph curry show that he can be the man on the team?? Can mark jackson improve these guys in his rookie season as a head coach?? Will bogut and jefferson have the major impact for the organization?? Can the organization with the worst playoff history turn it around??

Im playing 82 games 12 minute qtrs(game freak)

Starting Line up

Pg Stephen Curry(36)

Sg Klay Thompson(34)

Sf Dorell Wright(34)

Pf David Lee(34)

C Andrew Bogut(34)

6th man Nate Robinson(18)

Sf Richard Jefferson(13)

Sg Brandon Rush(13)

Sf/Pf Dominic McGuire(11)

C Andris Biedrins(9)

Pg Chris Jenkins(2)

Pf Jeremy Tyler(2)

The Miami Heat wasted no time in signing Greg Oden to a one year deal(UGH)

1st Game Golden State 113 - Los Angeles Lakers 117 @ Golden State

The crowd was rocking the Oracle Arena - excited about the new season.

We ran the Lakers the first half dominating but the second half was all laker basketball. We exchanged leads in the 4th but the lakers showed why they have the collection of championships. Andrew Bogut lead GSW with 29 pts and 11 boards, Dorell Wright followed with 22 pts, RJ gave us 16 pts off the bench. Steph had 14 pts and 11 asts and David Lee had 13 pts and 14 boards. The Lakers were led by the Black Mamba with 40 pts while their new PG Ramon Sessions gave em 25 pts. If this game has any indication of the what the season is gonna be like than I cant wait to play the rest.

a new WE BELIEVE era 2011-2012
